channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: About half of the states are expected to ban abortion or enact limits on the procedure if the Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade, as a leaked draft opinion indicates the court has privately voted to do. See what could happen in those states. https://t.co/vBU2UqSLSG

Sen. Mitch McConnell called for a criminal investigation and charges against whoever leaked the draft Supreme Court opinion overturning Roe v. Wade, escalating conservatives’ effort to focus public attention on the leak itself rather than its substance. https://t.co/5nIutqMOXq https://t.co/SMnu0k3Aue

While cautioning the decision isn’t final until the Supreme Court announces its opinion, Senator Susan Collins, a Republican, said the draft ruling does not align with conversations she had with two Trump-appointed justices she voted to confirm. https://t.co/ws8kOVxSSe https://t.co/Scv283DQNh
The typical abortion patient in the U.S. already has a child, is poor, is unmarried and in her late 20s, has some college education and is very early in pregnancy. https://t.co/3j6kgrfweN

“The Republican-appointed justices’ reported votes to overturn Roe v. Wade would go down as an abomination, one of the worst, most damaging decisions in modern history,” Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York and the majority leader, said on Tuesday. https://t.co/6V3pWhGChE https://t.co/3jLdBNQQlg

Elon Musk often acts on impulse and the certainty that he is 100% right, according to interviews with those who have worked with him. He has constructed an insular world of about 10 confidants who mostly agree with him and carry out his bidding. https://t.co/0XF7GtV6lV

Progressive lawmakers across Europe reacted with concern and surprise to the news that the U.S. Supreme Court might overturn Roe v. Wade.
“The right of women to decide what happens to our own bodies is a human right,” the first minister of Scotland said. https://t.co/LydVWSGG5e

The Supreme Court legalized abortion in the U.S. with its ruling on Roe v. Wade in 1973. Nearly 50 years later, the court privately voted to strike down the decision, a leaked draft opinion shows.
Here’s what to know about the case. https://t.co/YdkVrva7Ik
Cardi B and Donatella Versace arrive at the #MetGala. Cardi's Versace dress is made from almost a kilometer of chains and jewelry. https://t.co/5bHYEkkuG9 https://t.co/i9MpElEMWU
Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson arrive at the #MetGala. https://t.co/ofGBWfM1eB https://t.co/ogbabmSfg3

Progressive lawmakers across Europe expressed concerns and surprise that the U.S. Supreme Court had privately voted to strike down Roe v. Wade.
“It would be a terrible regression for American women,” one French senator said. https://t.co/V9P9XqoaKw

“Ending legal abortion will not end abortion,” said Cecile Richards, a former president of Planned Parenthood. “It simply will mean that women are no longer safe in this country.” https://t.co/rdNlOHfK1R

In the immediate aftermath of a leaked draft opinion that suggests the U.S. Supreme Court will overturn Roe v. Wade, supporters of abortion rights emphasized that the procedure was still legal — but under serious threat. https://t.co/bc7Oo6M9IV https://t.co/afnNsVONUe

Abortion would remain legal in about half of U.S. states if Roe v. Wade was overturned, but the rest would likely ban the procedure.
The number of abortions would probably fall, particularly among poor women in the South and Midwest. https://t.co/SRRRHYVDVe

Protesters flocked to the U.S. Supreme Court after reports emerged that a majority of justices had voted to strike down Roe v. Wade. The mood outside the court was a mix of anger and mourning. Some demonstrators shouted defiant chants; others sat silently. https://t.co/iGqgpFyiec https://t.co/ZqXsRPSgHr

Breaking News: A Philadelphia police officer who was fired after he fatally shot a 12-year-old boy in the back in March has been charged with murder in connection with the shooting, the authorities said Monday. https://t.co/iQDD8G3zUS

From December 2021: The typical abortion patient in the U.S. already has a child, is poor, is unmarried and in her late 20s, has some college education and is very early in pregnancy. https://t.co/qedBy7bhKo

The Supreme Court privately voted to overturn the Roe v. Wade abortion rights decision, a leaked draft opinion shows. Senator Chuck Schumer and Speaker Nancy Pelosi said it could become one of the “most damaging decisions in modern history.”
Live updates: https://t.co/icHcFHoh6s

Janelle Monáe arrived at the #MetGala in a dreamy Ralph Lauren gown. "A star draped in stars," our reporter writes.
Follow live updates from the red carpet: https://t.co/WeY8QINnDO https://t.co/I8C4er25rH
Jared Leto (the real one, at right) and Gucci’s Alessandro Michele arrived at the #MetGala dressed as identical twins. https://t.co/SBOqVKRmpR https://t.co/lPc8ctmjzs

Breaking News: The Supreme Court has privately voted to strike down Roe v. Wade, according to a leaked draft of its majority opinion published by Politico. https://t.co/DVfKUd6J1l https://t.co/ALWHGErymI
Fredrik Robertsson arrives at the #MetGala with his take on the Gilded Glamour theme. https://t.co/tszZfWYfin https://t.co/3fVOhXvrug
Gigi Hadid arrives at the #MetGala looking incredibly comfortable. https://t.co/0LTlAAjjyt https://t.co/4uTw6UOI5b
Michelle Yeoh arrived at the #MetGala wearing a mint green Prabal Gurung dress. Follow our red carpet updates: https://t.co/w6kvMymd8l https://t.co/rGSCxH9uPW
Billie Eilish arrives at the #MetGala in Gucci. https://t.co/B6fO0obWP2 https://t.co/MMz8FIktOO

Elon Musk, who dominated headlines recently after his successful bid to buy Twitter for $44 billion, appeared at the #MetGala with his mother, the supermodel Maye Musk. https://t.co/vPNEmqGSxe https://t.co/AZBl7QqRXe
Architecture is in the air: Alicia Keys arrives at the #MetGala in a Ralph Lauren dress inspired by the Empire State Building. https://t.co/NMl76TMvjN https://t.co/SQIt1CV2tT

Hillary Clinton arrived at the #MetGala in a Joseph Altuzarra dress that is embroidered with the names of American women who inspired her, including Abigail Adams and Harriet Tubman. https://t.co/TJG7ANFamv https://t.co/cwRP0uWrBP

Blake Lively, a co-host of tonight's #MetGala, arrived in a full bustle dress with a train silhouette, a tiara and opera gloves.
Follow live updates from the red carpet: https://t.co/z7vu5Jz2BV https://t.co/MLz29hsISa

Riz Ahmed is at the #MetGala in an undone silk shirt and undershirt. “This is an homage to the immigrant workers who kept the Gilded Age going,” he said.
Follow live updates from the red carpet: https://t.co/k9Y1Kcm1Vr https://t.co/FKekTCOov7

Amid the current crisis, Fiona Hill and other former advisers are connecting President Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine to Jan. 6. And they’re ready to talk.
Listen to the Sunday Read: https://t.co/MKlnHfAsUd

Tucker Carlson weaponized his viewers' fears to create what may be the most racist show in the history of cable news.
Our examination shows how intertwined his rise has been with the transformation of Fox News and U.S. conservatism. Some takeaways: https://t.co/esT86zvAqZ

Breaking News: A former New York City police officer was found guilty of assaulting a police officer with a metal flagpole during the Capitol riot last year. The Justice Department has won all four of its jury trials connected to the Jan. 6 attack. https://t.co/VOwOX8PaXB

Zhiwen Yan, a Chinese restaurant deliveryman and a beloved figure in his neighborhood in Queens, was shot and killed. No motive was offered, but officials said they were investigating the possibility that he was targeted because of his Asian ethnicity. https://t.co/OFYQshfMlG

The New York Times analyzed 1,150 episodes of the highest-rated prime-time show in cable news, “Tucker Carlson Tonight.” It revealed how Carlson pushes extremist ideas and conspiracy theories into millions of households every weeknight. https://t.co/KZUBK2UrHQ

"We want a change."
Many young Filipinos are aiming to upend a presidential election where the front-runner is Ferdinand Marcos Jr., the son of the late dictator. https://t.co/lsOfAdxQWV
Breaking News: The Supreme Court unanimously ruled that Boston violated the First Amendment when it refused to let a group raise a Christian flag at City Hall. https://t.co/lvPYldWgNb

"Two months of darkness."
Evacuations are underway for people hiding beneath the Azovstal steel factory in Mariupol, Ukraine. One worker said that she had not seen sunlight in weeks. https://t.co/4FNMCBB91S https://t.co/N1wyvwBfTG
The fact that Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson chose to make their red carpet debut in Washington was a pretty clear indication of how they wanted to be seen by the world. https://t.co/03mrWFFrMX

Russia committed about 65% of its ground combat forces to the war in Ukraine, and more than a quarter of those are now likely “combat ineffective,” Britain said. The assessment added to intelligence reports that Russian forces have suffered heavy losses. https://t.co/J2TOBmDRLV

As the presidential election in the Philippines nears, many young voters support Leni Robredo, the vice president. She faces long odds against Ferdinand Marcos Jr., son of a late dictator, as some in an older generation are nostalgic for strongman rule. https://t.co/mR3BtaVp7M

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi traveled to Kyiv over the weekend, leading the second senior American delegation to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky and declare support for Ukraine's fight against Russia. https://t.co/d2MxIjKfYF

Oleg Tinkov, one of Russia’s few self-made business tycoons, spoke out against his country’s war in Ukraine. Now he is in hiding.
In an exclusive interview he said, “I don’t believe in Russia’s future’’ under President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/fT5ta26ddn

Régine, who was credited with opening the world's first disco, has died at 92. She built a $500 million empire of 23 clubs in Europe, the Middle East and the Americas, including Régine’s in Manhattan, the most famous nightspot of its era. https://t.co/FMFz5XwWRn https://t.co/w9aTgR0WGX

Besieged by multiplying scandals and salacious accusations, Representative Madison Cawthorn, Republican of North Carolina, is under mounting pressure from both parties to end his short career in Congress. https://t.co/vgFpf2glnT

Tucker Carlson has weaponized his viewers' fears to create what may be the most racist show in the history of cable news.
A New York Times examination shows how intertwined his rise has been with the transformation of Fox News and U.S. conservatism. https://t.co/176OLUd00R

Tucker Carlson is the champion of the most ardent Donald Trump followers. After 2016, his show focused on the emotional core of Trump’s allure: white panic over an increasingly diverse U.S.
The shift powered Carlson's rise — and reshaped Fox News. https://t.co/MPDVIOql1p https://t.co/2kA4Da8gvl

Ukrainian soprano Liudmyla Monastyrska sang the title role in “Turandot” at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday, replacing a Russian diva who was dropped over past support of Vladimir Putin. At curtain calls, Monastyrska emerged wrapped in Ukraine's flag. https://t.co/QRSM8hZPUN https://t.co/rV8DaOlLHT

Nancy Pelosi made an unannounced visit to Ukraine’s capital Saturday, becoming the highest-ranking U.S. official to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky since the war started. She told him, "Our commitment is to be there for you until the fight is done." https://t.co/qiefJPVPMt https://t.co/ms1jTh5Fdg

Children who grew up in the U.S. under the protection of their parents’ temporary visas do not qualify for the DACA program, and risk losing their legal status when they turn 21. They are urging the Biden administration to act on an immigration overhaul. https://t.co/lD1Pw7rP3B
